snippet: A study of health care habits found that patients are still struggling to pay for medical care despite the economic recovery.
abstract: IMS Institute for Healthcare Informatics reports that patients cut back on prescription drugs and doctor visits in 2011, a sign that many Americans are still struggling to pay for health care despite the economic recovery; notes that prescriptions fell by 1.1 percent compared with 2010, and doctor visits fell by 4.7 percent.
lead_paragraph: A study of health care habits found that patients are still struggling to pay for medical care despite the economic recovery.

headline.seo: Americans Struggle With Medical Care Despite Economic Recovery
headline.main: Americans Cutting Back on Drugs and Doctor Visits
headline.print_headline: Americans Cutting Back on Drugs and Doctor Visits
